articles.title: Trump isn’t making a Super Bowl pick, but his press secretary isn’t staying impartial: ‘Go Patriots!’
articles.description:
New Hampshire native Karoline Leavitt let her allegiances known at a White House press briefing on Thursday.

The post Trump isn’t making a Super Bowl pick, but his press secretary isn’t staying impartial: ‘Go Patriots!’ appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt expressed support for the Patriots during a briefing on February 6.
Leavitt, a New Hampshire native, publicly backed the Patriots, highlighting regional loyalty.
Her comments may energize local Patriots fans ahead of the Super Bowl.

articles.title: What can 11 Patriots Super Bowls teach us about No. 12? Let’s hope some of this history repeats.
articles.description:
When the Patriots take the field Sunday night against the Seahawks, it will mark the 12th Super Bowl appearance in franchise history and the 10th this century.

The post What can 11 Patriots Super Bowls teach us about No. 12? Let’s hope some of this history repeats. appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Patriots will play in their 12th Super Bowl on Sunday night against the Seahawks.
This marks the 10th Super Bowl appearance for the Patriots in the 21st century.
Boston residents are hopeful for a repeat of past Super Bowl successes.

articles.title: 6 maps predicting snowfall totals on Saturday
articles.description:
"A period of snow very late Friday night through Saturday with the passage of an arctic front is increasingly likely."

The post 6 maps predicting snowfall totals on Saturday appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Snowfall expected late Friday night into Saturday due to an arctic front.
Predictions indicate varying totals across Boston, with some areas receiving up to 6 inches.
Residents should prepare for potential travel disruptions and hazardous road conditions.
